person.persName: Green Clay Smith (KY general and politician )

body.p: Richmond, Madison County, Kentucky attorney, politician, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Lena Duke Smith. Father of Eliza Clay Smith, Mary Buford Smith, Keith Duke Smith, Lena Duke Smith, and Green Clay Smith, Jr. Second lieutenant in the 1st Kentucky Cavalry Regiment in the Mexican War. Graduate of Transylvania University in 1849 and from the law department in 1852. Admitted to the bar in 1852. Attorney in Covington, Kentucky, in partnership with his father, John Speed Smith. School commissioner from 1853 to 1857 in Madison County, Kentucky. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1861 to 1863. Colonel in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Calvary Regiment (U.S.A.). Brigadier general and brevetted major general of volunteers. Member of the United States House of Representatives from the Sixth Congressional District of Kentucky as an Unconditional Unionist from 1863 to 1866. Delegate to the National Union Party Convention at Baltimore, Maryland, in 1864.
